resources.string: Required to perform emergency lock and wipe operations, and to monitor security attempts.
INSTANT LOCKDOWN: Immediately locks the screen and engages security protocols. Use this to quickly secure your device from nearby threats.
EMERGENCY DATA DESTRUCTION: Performs a factory reset to permanently erase all data on the device. This is an irreversible last-resort measure for extreme situations.
ACTIVE SURVEILLANCE: Continuously monitors unlock attempts. If the limit is exceeded, the auto-wipe protocol is engaged.
ANTI-FORENSIC PROTECTION: Automatically triggers a data wipe if a USB data connection is detected while the device is locked. This prevents forensic tools from extracting data.
INTRUSION THRESHOLD: Sets the maximum number of incorrect password attempts.\n\nDURESS PROTOCOL: If forced to unlock, intentionally enter WRONG password this many times to trigger a wipe.
WARNING: Charging your phone while locked might trigger a wipe if the charger requests data!

For the \'Inactivity Wipe\' feature to work reliably, you MUST disable battery optimization for this app.\n\nOtherwise, the system may kill the timer to save battery, preventing the wipe from happening.

This app can PERMANENTLY ERASE all data on your device.

1. By enabling these features, you accept full responsibility for any data loss.
2. The developer is NOT responsible for accidental wipes.
3. For 'Inactivity Wipe' to work if the phone is OFF, you MUST schedule 'Auto Power On' in your phone settings.

Do you accept these risks?
WARNING: This will factory reset the device and erase all data. This action cannot be undone.\n\nNote: On Android 10+, this requires Device Owner privileges.

To ensure the 'Dead Man's Switch' works even if your phone is OFF, you must enable 'Scheduled Power On'.

1. Tap 'Open Settings' below.
2. Look for 'Scheduled Power On/Off' or 'Auto Power On'.
3. Set a daily time (e.g., 03:00 AM) for the phone to turn itself on.
